dungeonhunt.item

Interface Item

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Armor, Weapon

    public interface Item

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decreaseDurability(int decrement)
      Decreases durability of the item by specified amount.
      void increaseDurability(int increment)
      Increase durability of the item by specified amount.
      void placeInInventory(Entity target)
      Places the item in the inventory of 'Entity target'
      void setDurability(int durability)
      Sets the durability of an item.
      void setViewableDescription(java.lang.String description)
      Sets the user viewable description of the item.
      void setViewableName(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the user viewable name of the item.
      void takeFromInventory(Entity target)
      Removes the item completely from 'Entity target' Useful for when a item (such as a sword) breaks.
      void tranferItem(Entity orgin, Entity target)
      Removes item from 'Entity origin' and gives it to 'Entity target' This is intended for use upon killing a monster with loot
      void use()
      Empty method.
      void use(Entity target)
      Empty method.

    • Method Detail

      • use

        void use()
        Empty method. Should be overridden by subclasses where appropriate. \n The no arguments method should inflict the effects upon the entity which owns the item

      • use

        void use(Entity target)
        Empty method. Should be overridden by subclasses where appropriate. \n The 1 argument method should be used to inflict the effects upon another entity: 'Entity target'
        Parameters:
        target -

      • placeInInventory

        void placeInInventory(Entity target)
        Places the item in the inventory of 'Entity target'
        Parameters:
        target -

      • takeFromInventory

        void takeFromInventory(Entity target)
        Removes the item completely from 'Entity target' Useful for when a item (such as a sword) breaks. This is the preferred method of removing an item, setDurability(0) should NOT be used explicitly.
        Parameters:
        target -

      • tranferItem

        void tranferItem(Entity orgin,
                 Entity target)
        Removes item from 'Entity origin' and gives it to 'Entity target' This is intended for use upon killing a monster with loot
        Parameters:
        orgin -
        target -

      • setDurability

        void setDurability(int durability)
        Sets the durability of an item.
        Parameters:
        durability -

      • decreaseDurability

        void decreaseDurability(int decrement)
        Decreases durability of the item by specified amount. Setting durability to 0 WILL destroy a item but is NOT recommended, use takeFromInventory() instead.
        Parameters:
        decrement -

      • increaseDurability

        void increaseDurability(int increment)
        Increase durability of the item by specified amount. This item will break if the durability reaches 0 or less. Calls takeFromInventory() to do so
        Parameters:
        increment -

      • setViewableName

        void setViewableName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the user viewable name of the item.
        Parameters:
        name -

      • setViewableDescription

        void setViewableDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Sets the user viewable description of the item.
        Parameters:
        description -
